ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned so many printmaking skills within one semester. I couldn't ask for more!
Learned new printmaking techniques and knowledge of the shop.
a lot of technical skills with the computer, and some cool printmaking techniques (photolitho, stone litho, screen printing, transfers)

I learned the basics of a variety of printmaking techniques (wax transfer, toner transfer, photolithography, stone lithography, collography, screen printing) and how these can be integrated into a single artwork. I also learned about contemporary artists who use printmaking in their practices.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The class was very dense and pushed me to challenge myself.

Covered a lot of techniques which was good but also the weakness of the course as there was not enough time to really develop those skills. Should have had longer class time to work and have critiques.
should do fewer techniques and more time with each, specifically stone litho and screen printing
I was not enough time for a home work.

The course tried to cover too many printmaking techniques in too short a time. It could be improved by cover fewer techniques in more depth. The print shop could benefit hugely from hiring a full-time technician to keep things organized and provide problem-solving assistance for students trying to work on assignments when the TAs and professor are not present. The shop aides were not successful in this regard.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Take this class if you want to learn the techniques!

I would recommend this course to another student who is able to work independently and has a strong interest in printmaking. It is not as directed as a course like Basic Drawing, so would not provide as good an introduction to students with little art experience. The techniques (wax transfer, toner transfer, photolithography, stone lithography, collography, screen printing) were all really interesting, but there is not enough time to really go into any of them in great depth. Pedro is a great professor and just a nice guy in general, and the few crits are really relaxed.
